Title.evidence: To assess the effect of a practice-level preoperative frailty screening and optimization toolkit (OPTI-Surg) on postoperative functional recovery and complications in elderly cancer patients undergoing major surgery.

Trial_Design.evidence: practices within the National Cancer Institute Community Oncology Research Program (NCORP) were randomized 1:1:1

Participants.evidence: Patients 70 years old or above undergoing curative intent surgery were eligible.

Intervention.evidence: usual care (UC), OPTI-Surg, or OPTI-Surg with an implementation coach.

Objective.evidence: To assess the effect of a practice-level preoperative frailty screening and optimization toolkit (OPTI-Surg) on postoperative functional recovery and complications in elderly cancer patients undergoing major surgery.

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was 8 weeks postoperative function (kcal/wk).

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: practices within the National Cancer Institute Community Oncology Research Program (NCORP) were randomized 1:1:1

Number_Randomised.evidence: From July 2019 to September 2022, 325 patients were enrolled in 29 practices.

Number_Analysed.evidence: One hundred ninety-nine (64 UC, 135 OPTI-Surg) and 279 (78 UC, 201 OPTI-Surg) were evaluable for primary and secondary analysis, respectively.

Result_Outcome.evidence: UC and OPTI-Surg patients did not significantly differ in total caloric expenditure (2.2 UC, 2.0 OPTI-Surg) after adjusting for baseline function ( P = 0.53).

Harms.evidence: UC and OPTI-Surg patients did not significantly differ in post-operative complications (25.6% UC, 35.3% OPTI-Surg, P = 0.5).
